intro: Protorhus viguieri, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are adapted for pollination by birds, particularly sunbirds, due to their nectar-rich structure.
